page.title: 20LOCAL NEWS New Bypass Road
page.content: {The Portobello Bypass. At present Portobello is in the middle of 3 years of{"road up" signs}and {traffic diversions}due to the construction of the new bypass road. This new road will be known officially as the{East Approach Road to Leith}and will cost around Â£25 million. It will be an integral part of the projected {City Bypasses}and will help to distribute traffic from these roads and improve access to the port of Leith and the industrial estates at Baileyfield and Seafield. It will also help to{relieve congestion on {Portobello High Street}and improve conditions for shoppers there. However during the construction period local bus services are being seriously disrupted and loud concerns are being voiced by traders whose business is falling due to poor access.
